result.execSummary:
The defendant James L Olson Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the ES on 2013CF7.  Court grants the defendant 143 days of sentence credit if probation becomes revoked.

miscConds.notes:
-Sex Offender Registration with the WI Sex Offender Registry Program
-No unsupervised contact with the victim.
-No Contact with any minor females under age 18 years.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Court orders defendant to submit a DNA Sample.
-Court will allow supervised contact with family members.

supervisions.notes: -Consecutive to any other sentence and to commence immediately. No huber, out of county service or out of county travel. Court grants 238 days of sentence credit.
-Court orders the court costs of $363.00 be reduced to a civil judgment.

Atty Michael Kapelis appears via zoom

8:38 a.m. Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Michael Kapelis via zoom. Gerise Laspisa in person for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Atty Kapelis - is prepared to proceed with sentencing after revocation. Court goes over right for defendant to be present beside his attorney. Defendant requests to proceed. ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Statement by Kathleen Van Voorhis regarding cash bond. Statement by the Court. Statement by ADA Laspisa - bond being addressed is on 2020CF101. Statement by the Court. Sentencing statement by ADA Laspisa. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. NO statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant:

-9 months county jail. No huber, out of county service or out of county travel. To commence immediately and consecutive to any other sentence.
-Court orders the court costs of $363.00 be reduced to a civil judgment.

Court grants the defendant 238 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 8:51 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 26, 2021 at 08:30 am.

State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions. ADA is unsure of compliance with victim witness rights. Off the record at 4:24 p.m. Back on the record at 4:37 p.m. Statement by ADA Laspisa - has attempted to contact the victim and is not able to go forward with the hearing today. Court sets for January 26, 2021 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 4:38 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 19, 2021 at 04:15 pm.

Statement by ADA Laspisa - is ready to proceed.

Court adjourns Sentencing after revocation to January 19, 2021 at 4:15 p.m.
(Atty Michael Kapelis)

No Contact provision of bond has been cancelled.
43

11:08 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Jeffrey Haase.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Haase has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, informs the court of one corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet/presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing argument by ADA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Haase.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2013CF7

1 1/2 years Initial Confinement and 1 1/2 years of Extended Supervision.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

-Court costs.  Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
-Sex Offender Registration with the WI Sex Offender Registry Program
-No unsupervised contact with the victim.
-No Contact with any minor females under age 18 years
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

2015CF128

SWD and places the defendant on probation for one year consecutive to the ES on 2013CF7.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Sex Offender Registration with the WI Sex Offender Registry Program
-No unsupervised contact with the victim.
-No Contact with any minor females under age 18 years.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

Court grants sentence credit of 143 days on 15CF128.

Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriffs Department.

Court orders defendant to submit a DNA Sample.

Statement by Atty Haase in regards to defendant's children.  Statement by the Court - will allow supervised contact with family members .

Court adjourned at 11:29 a.m.


Note:  CIP and SAP was not addressed at sentencing.  On 05/05/2016 - Per Judge - defendant is not eligible for either - defendant too old and no drug use indicated.
to counsel with a copy of the presentence investigation report
Sentencing hearing at 05-03-2016 11:00 am
Sentencing hearing at 04-05-2016 11:00 am

11:46 A.M.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Jeffrey Haase.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Haase - defendant will enter a plea.  ADA recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 on 2015CF128, with count 2 being dismissed and read-in and will plea to count 1 on 2013CF7 amended to 948.10(1)(a) Causing child to expose genitals and count 2 being dismissed and read-in and will dismiss and read-in 2015CF130.  Atty Haase and defendant have no objection to the count being amended on the record today.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters an Alford Plea.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 on 2015CF128 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in, finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as amended on 2013CF7 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in and orders 2015CF130 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a PSI be conducted and filed with the court in approx 60 days.  Court sets for Sentencing on April 5, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:57 a.m.

9:56 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Jeffrey Haase present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Haase - has received an offer to resolve all matters and is scheduled to meet with the defendant on Thursday afternoon and will advise the DA's office as soon as possible.  Statement by the Court.

Court adjourned at 9:57 a.m.
By Atty Jeffrey Haase
Status hearing at 01-19-2016 09:00 am

8:49 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaints and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court notes bond has been set on 2015CF128.  On 2015CF130 Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the January time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on January 19, 2016 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:51 a.m.
